key_risks: Intense competition from DIY tax software providers like Intuit (TurboTax)
Regulatory scrutiny over refund advance loans and pricing transparency
Revenue concentration due to seasonality of U.S. tax season
Customer complaints about service quality, pricing, and refund delays
Technological disruption from emerging fintech companies
controversies: Trademark dispute with Block, Inc. (formerly Square) over the 'Block' name and logo
Allegations of false advertising related to simplified pricing structures
Mixed customer reviews on platforms like Trustpilot and ConsumerAffairs
social_issues: Customer dissatisfaction with service quality and support
Potential reputational damage from regulatory and legal challenges
governance_issues: Ongoing regulatory scrutiny and legal disputes
Challenges in maintaining pricing transparency and compliance

sources.title: H&R Block Hit With False Ad Lawsuit Over Tax Service Pricing
sources.snippet: H&R Block Inc. has been accused of falsely advertising the pricing of its in-person and online tax preparation services.
